intro: Teucrium martinii, commonly known as mountain germander, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually violet or blue, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the branches. Teucrium martinii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
